. The town is almost entirely surrounded by the old walls.

value: content=The State Museum of Archeology has prehistoric, proto-historic and Hellenistic-Roman pieces. Descriptions of the exhibits are in Italian only.

On a clear day, a walk around the city walls provides views to the sea from one side, and forest on the other. There are also many churches and historic buildings to be seen.

value: price=Expect to pay 15-20 euros each for dinner, wine and dessert
content=Ragno d'oro means Golden Spider. This restaurant serves local specialties. The chocolate "salami" dessert is highly recommended.

Ciliegino, the local liqueur made from cherries.

value: directions=From Cingoli head towards Avenale village. The B&B is on a quiet country road halfway between the villages of Avenale and Troviggiano
content=Romantic farmhouse B&B with olive groves and panoramic views over the Marche countryside to the Adriatic Sea.

, Italy's largest and most famous complex of caves. However, try to avoid high summer as it can get quite crowded.
